page.title: 08Living in Mentmore
page.content: Mentmore is an attractive well-kept village, with many mature trees and shrubberies. Within its population of about 200 can be found{a variety of {occupations,}including 2 airline pilots,a banker,an R.S.P.B. official, someone in advertising and a staff member of the{Tring Natural History {Museum,}some of whom commute from nearby Cheddington station. A fete is held yearly on the Green, with a Barn Dance in a marquee, and a children's Christmas party in the Hall, all organised by the young married couples in the village. There are still four estate pensioners, allowed to occupy their cottages for life. Oddly, most of the children are boys, who belong to Cheddington Youth Club and Scout group. They are taken by bus to Wing schools, or at parents' expense to the smaller Marswoth school by car.
